title: The Xbox One S is a great gaming console, and you can get the disc-free version for $199 — $50 off its regular price
text:
The Xbox One S All-Digital (Disc-Free) Edition is a great way to get access to the awesome selection of Xbox One games at a reasonable price.

Walmart, Target, Amazon, and Best Buy are taking $50 off the Xbox One S, making it even more affordable than it usually is.

Deals range from the console alone, to bundles with a range of different games.

In the market for a new gaming console? Normally, you might want to wait until Black Friday, but several retailers are discounting the Xbox One S All-Digital Edition model by 20% ($50 off). The console now costs $200.

The All-Digital is the version of the Xbox One S that doesn't have an optical disc slot. This means that games are downloaded onto the console instead of them being played off discs. It's a great option for those who don't want to deal with physical media. If you prefer physical games (think of Gamestop's pre-owned section) or you would like to it to play Blu-rays and DVDs, this may not be the option for you. As an Xbox One S, it's also not as advanced as the Xbox One X, which supports 4K (the Xbox One S supports 4K with upscaling), among other things. Then again, most people can't tell the difference in image quality and can save themselves the $200 difference in price.

Walmart is also discounting some Xbox One S bundles (the disc version) with select games, like "NBA 2K19" and "Playerunknown's Battlegrounds." Discounts vary, but as of this posting, the NBA 2K19 bundle is just $201, making it an even better deal than the All-Digital option.

Get the Xbox One S All-Digital for $199 (originally $249) [You save $50] at Walmart | Amazon | Best Buy | Target
description: The Xbox One S is one of the most popular gaming consoles you can buy. Right now, Walmart is offering $50 off on the gaming console, making it $200.
